amendment.description: To prohibit the use of flexible schedules by Federal employees unless such flexible schedule benefits are made available to private sector employees not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the Fair Minimum Wage Act of 2007.

action.text: Proposed amendment SA 161 withdrawn in Senate.

Amendment SA 161 proposed by Senator DeMint to Amendment SA 100. (consideration: CR S1035-1038; text: CR S1037) To prohibit the use of flexible schedules by Federal employees unless such flexible schedule benefits are made available to private sector employees not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the Fair Minimum Wage Act of 2007.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 161 proposed by Senator DeMint to Amendment SA 100.
